note.p: Education: Trinity College, Cambridge; MA (1702); Leyden

Career: Had a post in the Revenue; lost money in the South Sea Bubble; Governor of New York and New Jersey (1720); transferred against his will to be Governor of Massachusetts (1728) and of New Hampshire (1729), where he quarrelled with the assembly who refused him a fixed salary
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DAB; DNB (father's entry); Venn; Dalton George I; Thomas
References: P Fontes da Costa, 'The Culture of Curiosity at The Royal Society in the first half of the eighteenth century', NR 2002 vo l56 pp 147-166
Notes: DNB and DAB list him under Burnet.
